intro: Planaltina lanigera, commonly known as the woolly planaltina, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
